double_jeopardy_round: MOVIE ENDING LINE OF THE DECADE

(1, 1).clue: Scrunching up the face of a celeb is a meme named for this lazy arboreal mammal; Kristen Bell approves

(2, 1).clue: (I'm Anderson Cooper.)  I trick you not, one of my ancestors, Harold Stirling Vanderbilt, is known for creating the "contract" type of this game

(3, 1).clue: The Bible attributes more than 3,000 proverbs to this monarch

(4, 1).clue: David Hasselhoff reprised his role as Mitch but was now a detective in a spinoff from this beach-y keen show

(1, 2).clue: A monkey in a coat became an Internet star after it was left at this Swedish furnishings store

(2, 2).clue: A Canadian computer scientist showed that, with best play, this game also called draughts will end in a draw

(3, 2).clue: At age 187 he had a son named Lamech & went on to live another 782 years

(4, 2).clue: Soup up a Pontiac Trans-Am to go 300 mph, install a peevish voice & David Hasselhoff & you get this '80s show

(1, 3).clue: BuzzFeed loves the baby meme named for this word that can mean either making a face or assaulting with intent to rob

(2, 3).clue: Also called "bones", these game pieces each have 0 to 6 pips on each end

(3, 3).clue: Dating from the 300s A.D., one of the oldest bibles is a codex that's been in this library since at least 1481

(4, 3).clue: Before Howard Stern there was Hasselhoff, one of the 3 original judges on this NBC show

(1, 4).clue: BuzzFeed went viral with a post on the best (& worst) parodies of this Macklemore-Ryan Lewis song about a store

(2, 4).clue: You can use the Chinese, Japanese or American rules in this game of tiles with dots, craks & bams

(3, 4).clue: Mentioned in Revelation 6, they are sometimes named as Conquest, Slaughter, Famine & Death
(3, 4).correct response: the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse

(4, 4).clue: In 2011 Hasselhoff guested as an ex-adult film star named Dondo on this FX biker show

(6, 4).clue: Shorthand for the mallet instrument mastered by Lionel Hampton

(1, 5).clue: BuzzFeed did an expose on the surly feline, real name Tardar Sauce, known as this meme

(2, 5).clue: Aztecs, Romans & Ottomans are all part of the fifth iteration of this Sid Meier computer game

(3, 5).clue: New Testament authors love this O.T. prophet, like when Matthew 1 references his "a virgin shall conceive"

(4, 5).clue: In a 1998 TV movie, the Hoff played "Nick Fury: Agent of" this organization that got its own TV show in 2013

(1, 1).clue: Liu Xiaobo, winner of the 2010 Nobel Peace Prize, spent 19 months in prison for his role in the June 1989 protests at this site

(2, 1).clue: Henry James once thought that this "Jungle Book" author "contained the seeds of an English Balzac"

(3, 1).clue: 1940s:"Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship"

(4, 1).clue: Used by the Aztecs to treat epilepsy, it was named for Swedish botanist Anders Dahl

(5, 1).clue: An actress who starred in "Grease" becomes the one Republicans want as Speaker of the House

(6, 1).clue: Small:This person with more than one spouse

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows a map on the monitor.)  A 1930 march against Britain's salt tax spanning 240 miles from an ashram at Sabarmati to the town of Dandi on the Arabian Sea was a nonviolent protest led by this man

(2, 2).clue: E.M. Forster called this "Lord Jim" author "misty in the middle as well as at the edges"

(3, 2).clue: 1930s:"Oh, no.  It wasn't the airplanes.  It was beauty killed the beast"

(4, 2).clue: Carolus Clusius of the University of Leiden was the chief founder of this flower's bulb culture in the Netherlands

(5, 2).clue: California's governor gets delicious as a "feminine" dessert made with apples & bread crumbs

(1, 3).clue: In 1970 an anti-Vietnam War protest at this state school in Ohio led to the deaths of 4 students

(2, 3).clue: This horror master didn't sugarcoat it: "(J.K.) Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer can't write worth a darn"

(3, 3).clue: 1970s:"This is Ripley, last survivor of the Nostromo, signing off"

(1, 4).clue: He wrote a play called "Protest" before becoming the interim president of Czechoslovakia

(2, 4).clue: F. Scott Fitzgerald said this author's "inclination is toward megalomania and mine toward melancholy"

(3, 4).clue: 1960s:"You maniacs!  You blew it up!  Ah, damn you... all to hell!"
